First, we need to establish the time period when Little Women was published. Little Women was published in two parts, in 1868 and 1869. This means that it was published after the Civil War (which ended in 1865). Therefore, it is possible that veterans of the Civil War could have read Little Women.

Secondly, we need to consider if Little Women would have been a popular book among veterans of the Civil War. Little Women is a coming-of-age novel that primarily focuses on the lives of four sisters. It does not directly relate to the experiences of war that veterans may have faced. However, it is a well-known and beloved novel that has stood the test of time. It is possible that veterans may have chosen to read Little Women as a source of entertainment or escapism from their war experiences.

Finally, we have to keep in mind that the literacy rate during the Civil War era was not high. However, those who were literate could have had access to Little Women through libraries or by purchasing the book.

Considering all of these factors, it is possible that Little Women could have been a book read by veterans of the Civil War. Therefore, the answer is (A) yes.
